intro: Gaura tripetala var. typica, commonly known as the showy gaura, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and clusters of delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and moist meadows, preferring partial to full sun. Its foliage is heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Gaura tripetala var. typica is valued in gardens for its light, airy appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
